DOC.brief_summary: Investigators compare 500 full term baby deliver SCD randomize two group , prone supine position . Investigators use Panda warmer build Nellcor pulse oximeter . Each infant heart rate ( HR ) , oxygen saturation via pulse oximetry , respiratory rate respiratory effort document every 1 minute first 5 minute life ; beyond initial 5minutes life , monitor well infant 's management do per current Weiler hospital protocol . The intervention group place prone position first five minute immediately birth , change supine position . The control group place supine birth . Investigators check incidence severity RD , supplemental oxygen need duration , positive pressure ventilation ( PPV ) need duration use respiratory support ( intubation ) . Additionally , investigator record number infant require admission NICU group , day ventilatory support well length hospitalization .
DOC.brief_title: Prone Supine Effect After Caesarean Delivery Respiratory Outcomes Full Term Infants

Decision initiate positive pressure ventilation /or oxygen supplementation guide publish NRP 2010 low saturation target ( 1 min < 60 % , 2 min < 65 % , 3 min < 70 % , 4 min < 75 % , 5 min < 80 % ) and/or grunting , retraction ; discontinuation high saturation target ( 1min > 65 % , 2 min > 70 % , 3min > > 75 % , 4 min > 80 % , 5 min > 85 % ) resolution respiratory distress . DOC.criteria: Investigators include Obstetrical patient deliver Weiler Hospital . All woman labor , undergo schedule caesarean delivery term ( 37 42 complete week gestation ) , approach consent participate study . Investigators exclude woman prior rupture membrane , woman receive magnesium sulfate . Any woman know drug history approach study participation . Investigators exclude fetus know congenital anomaly meconium stain fluid present . Investigators also exclude mother maternal fever , chorioamnionitis , fetal distress e.g . abnormal fetal heart tracing , well non vigorous newborn birth ( define per NRP guideline infant apnea/gasping , heart rate < 100/min , poor tone ) .
